sources.title: The 300 Spartans (1962)
sources.description: The 1962 film "The 300 Spartans" is a historical drama directed by Rudolph Maté. It portrays the famous battle of Thermopylae, where King Leonidas of Sparta and his 300 soldiers stand against the vast Persian army led by King Xerxes.The film focuses on King Leonidas as he leads his warriors to defend Greece against the Persian invasion. Despite overwhelming odds, the Spartans showcase their fighting prowess, embodying themes of honor, sacrifice, and loyalty.

sources.title: The 300 Spartans (1962) Richard Egan · Diane Baker
sources.description: A historical film about the invasion of Greece by the Persian king Xerxes (519-465 BC) and the now legendary heroic battle of the Spartans at Thermopylae (480 BC). Brilliantly staged battle and crowd scenes authentically demonstrate the ancient art of war.

metadata.Plot: Essentially true story of how Spartan king Leonidas led an extremely small army of Greek Soldiers (300 of them his personal body guards from Sparta) to hold off an invading Persian army now thought to have numbered 250,000. The actual heroism of those who stood (and ultimately died) with Leonidas helped shape the course of Western Civilization, allowing the Greek city states time to organize an army which repelled the Persians. Set in 480 BC.
metadata.Writer: George St. George, Ugo Liberatore, Remigio Del Grosso
metadata.Actors: Richard Egan, Ralph Richardson, Diane Baker
